content.prompt: Which of the following pieces of evidence from the article best supports the cause of the decrease in the Calanus population in the Gulf of Maine?

choices.label: The deep-water temperature in the Gulf of Maine has increased by approximately 9Â°F since 2004.
Calanus are getting caught in fishing nets from large-scale commercial fishing vessels.
There has been an increased number of North Atlantic right whales feeding in the Gulf of Maine.
The North Atlantic right whales are now feasting year-round in preparation for autumn mating season.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Describe the author's reasoning (use of evidence to support a claim).
